titleStmt.title: (Copy of) list of priests and temple inventory

msContents.summary: List of priests and temple inventory has been submitted by two priests in Bakchias

msItemStruct.note: Belonging to P. Yale 907 according to E. H. Gilliam, The archives of the temple of Soknobraisis at Bacchias, Yale Classical Studies X, Yale 1947, p. 244-46. The translation below of P. Yale 907 includes the small fragment P. Lund. 299. Cf. P. Lund. 2315, too.
Former shelfmark or inv. no.: Ag I 22 R a; with Y.P. 907 (in pencil on old glass frame)
Source of description: Recto; Verso blank

origin.origPlace: Bakchias, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

provenance.p: Purchased in Berlin by Lund University Library in 1933, from prof. Carl Schmidt; Isabella Andorlini "Scavi e acquisti di papiri negli anni '30: il caso dei PLund" in Comunicazioni, Firenze 1995, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, p. 45-50

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: To Monimus Gemellus, basilikos grammateus of the meris of Herakleides of the Arsinoite nome, from Orsenouphis, son of Horos, and Theudis, son of Orsenouphis, priests of the temples (?) of the villagge of Bacchias. We have submitted to you a list of priests and an inventory of the aforesaid village for the current seventeenth year, and ... the duplicate. (Second hand): It has been submitted to the basilikos grammateus, the seventeenth year ... the fifth intercalated day. (First hand): The seventeenth year of Lucius Septimius Severus Pius Pertinax and Marcus Aurelius Antoninus Pius, Augusti, and Publius Septimius Geta Caesar Augustus, Mesore, the fifth intercalated day.
